DOC.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes After Bilateral Implantation ZEISS AT LISA TRI TORIC IOL
DOC.detailed_description: Twenty patient ( 40 eye ) diagnose cataract cataract surgery indication select participate study . The surgery perform surgeon 2 week interval surgery first second eye . After approval research project Research Ethics Committee patient understand sign Informed Consent Informed ( IC ) surgery . All patient operate conventional phacoemulsification implantation intraocular lens provide manufacturer . Patients five study visit , include preoperative visit , operative visit four postoperative visit . All patient submit follow routine assessment preoperatively demographic patient information record detailed medical history obtain . - VFQ-25 Questionnaire - Identification dominant eye ; - Visual acuity - Refraction - Slit lamp examination - Tonometry - Self-keratometry ; - Corneal topography ; - Microscopy speculate - Fundus examination . In addition , routine preoperative measure perform . lens power calculation perform eyes ensure qualification ( lens power within diopter range ( D ) available ) prepare surgery ( get lens ) . The emmetropia ( Â± 0.5 D ) target patient .
DOC.criteria: Patients older 50 year Cataract diagnosis indicate surgery eye Astigmatism Corneal 12D Ability provide consent clarification study participation Significant irregular corneal astigmatism show Corneal topography ; Corneal astigmatism 12D Patients diagnose severe visual degenerative disorder ( e.g . macular degeneration disorder retina ) Previous corneal surgery ; Amblyopia Planning multiple procedure , include IRL , LASIK , etc . surgery study Endothelial dystrophy clinically significant cornea ( eg , Fuchs dystrophy ) Corneal disease activity ( eg , herpes simplex , herpes zoster , etc . ) Severe diabetic retinopathy Retinal detachment Glaucoma Patients present illness acute condition chronic severe opinion investigator , would increase surgical risk confound research result Any patient take part another study involve ocular surgery
